result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey James Hejdak

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jeffrey James Hejdak.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference.  Off record discussion held regarding global resolution of this matter with 3 other pending cases (22CF1695, 22CM311 and 22CM312) placed on the record.  Br. 9 has agreed to accept transfer of the 3 cases for global resolution and sets this matter for a plea and sentencing hearing.  Defendant to be produced.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Jeffrey James Hejdak.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense advises of possible global resolution and requests adjourned status conference. Request granted. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail/bond hearing.  Defense requested bail modification.  State does not object.  Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  All conditions remain the same.  State has turned over discovery.  Case scheduled for scheduleding conference.  Court scheduled deadline to file any reports, plea forms or motions by July 24, 2022.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in court, appear by video with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear by video.  Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer A. Stikl   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17. Defense wants to be heard on bail. Date provided by Br. 17 Clerk.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, appear by video. Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, appear by video defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Court adjourn due to court conjecture. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin Mcginn appear by video for Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was not present. State needs more time for witness to appear.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey James Hejdak appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jeffrey James Hejdak not in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/22 @ 2:30p
